definition: (idiom) to continue in the same old rut/diehard conservative attitudes
to follow/to adhere to/to abide by
to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining

sentences.english: This is not a question of being more liberal or more conservative.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题无关自由开放还是因循守旧。

sentences.english: While China doesn't follow the rules, India has too many rules to follow.
sentences.chinese: 中国并不循规蹈矩，而印度却太因循守旧。

sentences.english: The life hacker thinks and acts unconventionally.
sentences.chinese: 生活黑客的想法和行为则不因循守旧。

sentences.english: Beneath his buttoned-down appearance was a tough mind and a brave heart.
sentences.chinese: 在他那因循守旧的外表下面是坚韧的意志和勇敢的心。

definition: stuck in the old ways (idiom); refusing to acknowledge new ideas/stagnating and conservative
to cherish the outmoded and preserve the outworn (idiom); conservative/stickler for tradition
to swallow ancient learning without digesting it (idiom)/to be pedantic without having a mastery of one's subject
to shut one's eyes and stop one's ears/out of touch with reality/to bury one's head in the sand
to stand still without advancing (idiom); to hesitate and hold back
stick-in-the-mud/to stick to old ways/stubbornly conservative
to follow old patterns/to imitate existing models/to continue along the same lines
